title: How to write a permission letter for not being to school for four days - Quora

response.answer_text: The first thing you should do is determine what requirements your school has for allowing such a long absence. Any letter you write must be sure to address the school’s requirements. Second, you ought to show why it’s important for you to be absent now. Why can’t your event wait until school is out? Third, I’d make sure I had my parent or guardian come in to the school and make a pitch. You’ll want to show that you haven’t made all this up. Last your actual letter needs to be formal, spell checked, addressed to the right person, etc etc.

Well, that depends on the circumstances of the absence. If you were sick for 4 days, you could say that you had a late case of the Flu, or whatever disease ailed you, if it is something that the attendance office will believe could make you miss 4 days of school. If you skipped 4 days of school for a trip or something of the like, and you don’t want to get any unexcused absences, I would make something up. A family crisis, perhaps, or just claim that you had a major sickness. You probably should’ve let the attendence office know that you had a major illness during the first day you were sick, or perhaps you could’ve lied about the sickness if you were just skipping school. Really, your course of action should just depend on WHY you were absent. And if you were just skipping school…do yourself a favor and don’t, it will hurt you in the long run.
